page.title: 01SCHOOLS 1
page.content:
St. Philip Howard High School is the only senior school in the block.It is an 11-18 Catholic Comprehensive.There are 732 pupils,46 teachers and 10 ancillary{staff}.Pupils come from West Sussex,as far as Midhurst in the north,Selsey in the south,Angmering in the east and Southbourne in the west. Pupils travel by train to Barnham,by coach from outlying areas,by bicycle or walk if they live close to the school. The boys'{uniform}consists of a black blazer,grey trousers,maroon tie and grey pullover. Girls' uniform consists of a maroon blazer,chequered blouse,grey knee-length skirt and grey or maroon cardigan.{Facilities}include a chapel,tennis courts,computers,craft rooms,playing fields,gymnasium and hall.The school was opened in 1959.
By Louise Finkle
